vague_description: Calculate the optimal planting ratio of blueberries to raspberries while staying within the constraints of available labor and budget.
detailed_description: John has a \var{TotalAcres} acre berry farm on which to plant blueberries and raspberries. John has $\var{BudgetWatering} to spend on watering and \var{TotalLaborDays} days worth of labor available. For each acre of blueberries, \var{LaborBlueberry} days worth of labor and $\var{CostWaterBlueberry} in watering costs is required. For each acre of raspberries, \var{LaborRaspberry} days worth of labor and $\var{CostWaterRaspberry} in watering costs is required. The profit per acre of blueberries is $\var{ProfitBlueberry} and the profit per acre of raspberries is $\var{ProfitRaspberry}. Formulate an LP problem in order to maximize profit.
target_objective: Maximize the profit from planting blueberries and raspberries
target_constraints: Number of acres of blueberries is non-negative
Number of acres of raspberries is non-negative
Total acres of blueberries and raspberries cannot exceed TotalAcres
Total labor for blueberries and raspberries cannot exceed TotalLaborDays
Total watering cost for blueberries and raspberries cannot exceed BudgetWatering
Labor for blueberries per acre is LaborBlueberry
Watering cost for blueberries per acre is CostWaterBlueberry
Labor for raspberries per acre is LaborRaspberry
Watering cost for raspberries per acre is CostWaterRaspberry
target_parameters: Total acreage available for planting berries
Total days worth of labor available
Days of labor required per acre of blueberries
Watering cost per acre of blueberries
Days of labor required per acre of raspberries
Watering cost per acre of raspberries
